title: Solicitor
overviewOfRole: Progressing legal matters and transactions, applying legal knowledge and commercial judgement to produce solutions which meet clients' needs.
occupationalSummary: <p>This role has responsibility for providing legal advice to clients through: acting ethically, with professionalism and judgement; progressing legal matters and transactions; applying legal knowledge and commercial judgement to produce solutions which meet clients' needs and address their commercial or personal circumstances; deploying the full range of legal skills - research, interviewing and advising, advocacy, negotiation, drafting, communicating orally and in writing; establishing and maintaining effective and professional relationships with clients and other people; and managing themselves and their own work effectively.</p>

knowledges.detail: Maintain the level of competence and legal knowledge needed to practise effectively, taking into account changes in their role and/or practice context and developments in the law
Draw on a sufficient detailed knowledge and understanding of their field(s)of work in order to practise effectively

behaviours.detail: Act honestly and with integrity, in accordance with the law and with regulatory requirements and the Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA)Handbook and Code of Conduct
Work within the limits of their competence and the supervision which they need
Apply understanding, critical thinking and analysis to solve problems
Communicate clearly and effectively, orally and in writing
Establish and maintain effective and professional relations with clients
Establish and maintain effective and professional relations with other people

skills.detail: Develop and advise on relevant options, strategies and solutions
Draft documents which are legally effective and accurately reflect the client's instructions
Undertake effective spoken and written advocacy
Plan, manage and progress legal matters and transactions

Initiate, plan, prioritise and manage work activities to ensure that they are completed efficiently, on time and to an appropriate standard, both in relation to their own work and work that they lead or supervise
Keep, use and maintain accurate, complete and clear records

involvedEmployers: Addleshaw Goddard, Barclays, Browne Jacobson, Burges Salmon, Clyde and Co, DAC Beachcroft, Dentons, DWF, Eversheds, Gateley LLP, Kennedys Law, Lewis Silkin, Mayer Brown, Olswang, Pannone LLP, The Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS), Simmons & Simmons, Stephenson Harwood, Thomas Eggar, Withers, Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (CiLEX), Law Society, Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA).
reviewDetails: this apprenticeship will be reviewed in accordance with our change request policy.
